s.text: This is in spite of the fact that I taught courses on technology for more than 10 years before I retired and have even written books on the new technology.
(We used to say that when you were an undergraduate at Harvard, you were one of the few students who knew that one should not begin a sentence with "Hopefully," and more, why one should not do so.)

But now the Times has a Boston edition, with the Boston weather and television schedule, and the "Tab," a "community" paper with special town editions, such as Cambridge, tells me what is playing at the local movie houses.
